reviews.review:
The game is fun.

If I wanted to see a loading screen, I would go look up a picture of a loading screen.

Most likely, 99% of the time, you wont load into a game. You sit. For minutes on end on a loading screen. 

Until the developers fix this bug, or whatever it is. The game is not playable.

Dead by Daylight - что бы то ни говорили, это уникальная в своём роде игра с интересным и увлекательным геймплеем.

Здесь нам даётся выбор, за какого персонажа мы будем играть. Мы можем взять на себя роль беспощадного [b]маньяка[/b], задача которого - [b]убить всех выживших в матче[/b] (повесив на крюк или же убив своим оружием при помощи специально предназначенных для убийства перков или подношений) или же стать одним из [b]выжившиx[/b] (по правилам игры выживших четверо в одном матче). Задача выживших - [b]починить определённое количество генераторов на карте, открыть ворота и сбежать от маньяка, не дав ему убить кого-либо из своей команды.[/b] У каждой роли, будь то маньяк или выживший, есть определённые сложности на пути к безжалостному убийству или к успешному побегу. Для упрощения задачи у каждого персонажа существует своя так называемая "кровавая паутина", где персонажа можно прокачивать, добавляя ему навыки, подношения, предметы и улучшения для этих предметов.

Бесспорно, [b]10/10[/b] за интересную идею и пугающую атмосферу, которая лично у меня вселяет страх до сих пор, (и это после 500 часов в игре), особенно, оставаясь наедине с маньяком :-) Важно то, что несмотря на неизменную идею игры, каждый матч против маньяка или выживших уникален по-своему, так как у каждого игрока есть своя стратегия, что и делает эту игру увлекательной, затягивающей и интересной.

Конечно, в игре есть свои недоработки, о чем свидетельствует большой процент негативных отзывов. Например, серьезная проблема с оптимизацией уже на протяжении многих месяцев. Помимо этого, судя по отзывам, появляется все больше читеров, даже несмотря на то, что в игру добавили систему репортов. Хотя лично мне попадалось от силы 5-7 игроков, использующих читы. К тому же, если вы внимательно играете за маньяка и в принципе умеете за него играть, услышите вдохи выжившего в траве или за стеной и пойдёте навстречу ему, то ждите в конце матча тучу негативных комментариев о том, какой вы наглый читер с вх и прочее.
话说这个游戏没见过有什么新手教程直接就上手和人联机，本来也可以不在意这些 ，但是匹配系统问题也很大，每次一个1级的号经常匹配到50级的是什么鬼？？让一个刚玩的新手连地图都不怎么熟悉，就直接跟一群老油条一起玩？
好玩，但是BUG太多，有点影响游戏体验

[h1]''We are working on it''[/h1] -Dave the creator

I have had many issues with this Dave, first the unstable game, then the unpromised patches, go on go on...

I first posted a negative review for this game, but after removing it I gave it a try again. Sadly I still can't recommend it because they haven't fixed most of the main issues in the game. 

Campers, toxic community, stalkers, all of it is included in this game. First of all campers; yes, it is a strategy to use against your opponents but 75% of the players despise campers. Why you say?? Because they can't get their gorgeous altruistic points, they can't teabag the killer with their friends etc etc. This has been a major issue since the release of this game and the devs keep saying ''we are working on it, we know about this problem, we heard you!''

Next stop, Toxic community / stalkers. This has been one of the Major Major MAJOR issues. Either when you win or lose a game. If you win as a killer, the survivor will probably call you a hacker, a camping asshole (even if you didn't camp a single second), or a douchebag for killing them. This has been bothering me, but no this is not even everything. Yes you have a mute chat button in the game, but that doesn't stop the salty survivors from going on your steam profile and write death threats, insults with cancer, diseases etc. One time I got spammed to hell on my steam profile by a person who lost against me in my previous game. I then decided to disable profile comments temporarly and the next minute, my phone vibrates and it gives me a pop up that someone posted a comment on my recent video. He then continued to spam me on my youtube channel. Eventually I blocked and reported him from both YouTube and Steam. This is one of the first times I experienced this kind of salt.

When you manage to lose a game as a survivor the killer will say ''gg ez noobs'' or ''get some skill, you are rank 1''. When you lose as a killer you will get a higher cunt level e.g. ''pfft camping noob and we still won'', ''gg dude'', when all they did was sabotaging all your hooks, which is basically rejecting your chances to kill / win the game.

The developers try to convince the community by repeating the magic sentence ''We are working on it''. This fooled us too many times already and this game isn't functioning properly for a fully released steam game. Even early access games (Blackwake for example) got less bugs than this. I would change my review if the developers finally changed the major problems instead of adding new DLC every 3 months. The game is losing its population because the killers do not enjoy getting pallet looped or infinited and the survivor doesn't like facecampers and tunnelers (focusing one specific person the whole game, till he either dies or ragequits).

I made several montages for this game, yes it is fun to play with friends. If you do invest time in this, remember there are other games that reward you more then DbD does.

This is based on my 220 hours of playing this game, and yes both Rank 1 Killer and Survivor.

If you want to play a game where it favors the killer at ALL TIMES, play this game! Been playing this game for 150+ hours and It gives the killer one hit knockdown melees, perks to see your steps longer, perks to hear your breating in closets louder, perks to even sens where you are, perks that make it impossible to wiggle out of the killer, perks to make it impossible to set yourself free from a bear claw, perks to destroy woog planks quicker, perks to melee quicker, and offerings like instant death each survivor. This game also has the MOST OP killers like Myers where is is super sneaky so you cannot sense him with your heart, or any perks, and one hit melees you. The Trapper where the perks mentioned above make it near impossible to beat. The Hillbilly where he can also one shot melee you with his chainsaw, The Wraith that can go invisible, The Nurse that can teleport through walls, and now THe Hag where she can teleport through her own black magic sites anywhere on the map.

The survivors do get perks, but none that are as good as the killers. The survivors do get offerings, but only good ones are ones like "75% more bloodpoints...". Yes there are 4 survivors, but what is that when the killer runs faster than you and is fully equipped with so many OP Perks and abilites. 

Game is really worth 5 bucks. So broken as well, tooooooo many bugs.

Killers Should...
- Not be able to see the survivor steps. The killer is already faster then the survivor. Just play smart, just like the fucking survivors do.
- Be penalized if they camp a hooked survivor. Maybe dramaticaly slow down is pace, blur his vision, mute his senses. Somehow, do something. I mean camp within a 10-15 meter range. Most say they dont "camp", but they are simply just going in circles around the hooked waiting for somehow to unhook....CAMP! They can get away with anything. Unfair

Survivors Should...
- Be able to crawl way quicker when down. and be able to get back up after a short period. Otherwise, the killer would just stand over you waiting for your death. When all hooks are gone, the killer just knock us down and camps. Unfair. WTF is the point of sabo then?
- Should be able to run freely without worrying about their steps being traced.
-Should be able to have an evade option to cross up the killer (a quick turn right or left)

Este juego engancha (nunca mejor dicho xD)

+ PROS

+ Divertido (sobre todo si juegas con amigos).
+ Tensión máxima y sustos garantizados.
+ Habilidades que irás desbloqueando, tanto de asesino como de superviviente.
+ Cada tipo de superviviente y de asesino tiene sus características particulares.

- CONTRAS

- Por lo general es MUY LENTO encontrando partidas si juegas con amigos.
- Varios asesinos y supervivientes son DLC's de pago.
- "Matchmaking" absurdo o inexistente.
- Bugs... muchos bugs.

------------------------------------------------------------

EDITO:

Después de jugar más de 100 horas tengo que decir que el juego tiene MIL BUGS y MIL AÑOS buscando partidas si juegas con 2 o más amigos. Si juegas solo, tanto de asesino como de superviviente es casi instantáneo. No tiene ningún sentido. Menos DLC y más arreglar bugs y el sistema de búsqueda de partidas.

En el estado actual del juego, no debería recomendarlo, pero tengo que confesar que sigo jugando porque el juego en sí me gusta, pero si lo compras prepárate para:

- Largas esperas si juegas con amigos (y si juegas solo muchas veces te saldrá el bug de carga infinita y tendrás que cerrar el juego con ALT+F4, a no ser que le des a "sobrevive con amigos" y luego le des a "listo" sin invitar a nadie).

- Desconexiones aleatorias, o gente que aparentemente está en tu lobby y realmente no está, algo que podrás comprobar al ver que no están en la partida cuando comienza, por lo que es habitual ser 4 y comenzar siendo 2 o 3, sin que aparentemente se haya desconectado nadie. Puedes apostar por ello cuando comience la partida y alguno/s no le hayan dado a "Listo". No es que no le hayan dado, es que simplemente no están (el juego les ha echado pero sigue estando en la sala).

- Desconexiones de los asesinos, ya sea en el lobby (si ven que váis bien equipados) o cuando comienza la partida (si no les gusta el mapa, por ejemplo). Puede ser problema del juego a no ser que sean desconexiones intencionadas. No lo sé, pero pasa a menudo. Por lo que prepárate para perder tus mejores ofrendas (ley de Murphy).

- Equiparte con cajas de herramientas o botiquines, y que aparezcan atravesando tu antebrazo, y no puedas utilizarlos... eso sí, si mueres las pierdes, por supuesto. Esto me ha pasado muchas veces.

- Comenzar la partida y que no puedas utilizar tus habilidades... por ejemplo curar a los demás, curarte a ti mismo, sabotear, etc. También es común en esos casos que no puedas forcejear cuando el asesino te agarra... incluso que no puedas ver dónde están tus compañeros cuando los cuelgan de los ganchos.

- Huir del asesino, tirar un palé y que aparezcas en el lado contrario hacia donde ibas corriendo, es decir, al lado del asesino. Un clásico.

- Ser un asesino y que aparezca repetidamente en bucle infinito la animación de cuando alguien repara un generador o falla en la revisión del mismo. También me ha sucedido de ver a todos los supervivientes con una silueta roja al igual que puedes ver los generadores o los ganchos (ambas cosas sólo me sucedieron una vez).

- Como el host es el asesino, preparate a lidiar con el LAG. Será uno de los juegos más vendidos de Steam, pero... ¿poner servidores dedicados para las partidas?, NO, que el asesino sea el host, y si se está descargando porno o tiene una conexión de ♥♥♥♥♥♥, te jodes.

- Perder tu partida, todo tu progreso, habilidades, items, etc. Debido a los muchos bugs del juego, es común que se corrompa el fichero que guarda tu progreso en la nube. Recomiendo DESACTIVAR STEAM CLOUD para este juego, o hacer frecuentes backups del savegame... es un fichero que está en el directorio Steam/Userdata/[idsteam]/381210/Remote/ProfileSaves/).

- Y mil bugs/glitches más que descubrirás con el tiempo...

Il y a 3 ans, j'ai décidé de faire une pause sur ce jeu.
Aujourd'hui j'y suis de retour, de nouvelles maps, de nouveaux tueurs, de nouvelles compétences, et visiblement toujours la même mentalité, une communauté toujours aussi toxic, voir même pire, malgré un jeu qui en lui même est vraiment intéressant, au final il se limite à une chose en terme de résumé :  prendre un malus de temps parce qu'un tueur à décidé de vous camper, et qui en plus, au final est encouragé par les créateurs.
Un jeu censé être pour le plaisir et la détente avec des amis, cache en réalité un vrai jeu de frustration et de dégoût.
Un vrai plaisir d'encore une fois devoir arrêter ce jeu à cause de quelque chose qui pourrait être réglé.. . Enfin comme dit le dicton c'est :" uriner dans un violon ", après tout.
Avec un peu de chance ce jeu se terminera dans les prochaine année, et j'espère de tout coeur qu'ils s'en rendront compte trop tard, pour en conclure que le bien-être utilisateur passe avant l'argent.

制作组一直想强调这是一款恐怖游戏，可其实是一款竞技游戏。组队系统增加了人类的合作性，我在想能不能出个双屠夫模式啊，农场主很孤单呢。

现在想来很后悔购买了这款游戏。回归玩一次被个屠夫守地窖守到难受。我不适合这种竞技类游戏，玩个游戏都能闹得心情爆炸，难受。

After a rough launch in 2016 and many years of updates, Dead by Daylight has evolved into one of the best horror games you can play today. When everything works there's literally no game like it--where else can you play as iconic film and TV characters like Ash Williams or Nancy Wheeler as you run away from villains like Ghost Face, Freddy Krueger, or Michael Myers? The premise might seem silly, but Dead by Daylight turns it into one of the most thrilling multiplayer experiences around, pitting one terrifying Killer against four hapless Survivors as they scramble to escape the map alive.

An sich von der Idee ist das Spiel wirklich nicht schlecht, aber seit einigen Monaten gibt es in diesem Spiel nur noch Bugs und Glitches. 2/3 der Zeit in diesem Spiel verbringt man mit warten auf ein Spiel (man wird aus der Lobby geschmissen oder es steht 0 Killer zur Verfügung, etc) und wenn man endlich ein Spiel gefunden hat, hat man entweder einen bis zwei leaver oder Killer leavt instant oder der Killer facecamped hardcore. Die Publisher wissen wie viele Fehler das Spiel hat tun aber nichts dagegen und das geht seit Monaten so. 

Also kurz gesagt solange dass Spiel von Bugs nur so wimmelt würde ich davon abrraten es zu kaufen

Horror in games (and films) is too often characterised by jump scares; shocking, startling events designed to trigger a fight-or-flight response. Dead by Daylight, to its credit, eschews these in favour of real horror--a gradual increase in tension resulting from the unshakeable sense of impending doom. That it manages to do this in an asymmetrical competitive action game is what is truly impressive about it.

Dead by Daylight features two teams--four survivors and one killer--and pits them against one another in a battle for all the marbles: The four survivors need to repair five generators to power the gates which will allow them to escape. The killer needs to find the survivors, knock them down, put them on hooks and then sacrifice them to their otherworldly gods. The odds are skewed heavily in favour of the invincible killer, and as a result playing Dead by Daylight as a survivor can be a nerve-rattling, sweat-inducing, terrifying experience.

After queuing into a game with three other survivors, Dead by Daylight puts you in one of several eerie horror environments--a dilapidated farm, a run-down manor, a rickety junkyard--and tells you, very simply, to fix the generators to escape. When you find the generators, you then need to repair them--a painstakingly slow process, where you hold the left mouse button down while crouching in front of it. If you're alone, repairing the generator can take more than a minute. As you crouch next to the very noisy generator, the game will throw skill-tests at you by way of a rotating bar--if you fail the QTE, the generator will backfire. This creates a noisy explosion, and the killer is visually alerted to the location of the backfire, turning you into a target.


If the killer does find you (and he probably will) your options are limited. If you have a flashlight you can blind him temporarily, but your best bet is to run away. The killer moves faster than you can run, maintaining the traditional horror movie 'ominous walk', but you can slow him down by leaping through windows, or pushing down pallets to block his path. You want to put as many of these obstacles in between the two of you as possible as you flee for your life.

Fortunately for the survivors, a sixth sense mechanic alerts them to the presence of a nearby killer--the closer the killer is, the faster your survivor's heart beats. Unfortunately the sound is obscured by generator revving as you repair it. When 90% repaired, the generator nearly drowns out the heartbeat entirely, forcing you to rely solely on your eyes to see the killer.

When you play as the killer, you're able to see all the map's generators at all times, allowing you to patrol them. If any of them are making noise, you know at least one survivor has been working on it, and you can hunt for signs that the others are nearby. Panicked survivors will sprint away, leaving scratches on nearby walls and breaks in the grass, and you can follow these markings to find your prey. Once you find your prey you chop them down, pick them up and put them on a hook, sacrificing them to your god after 60 seconds.

The scoring system initially encourages players to create exciting gameplay opportunities by rewarding risky play. Survivors who engage in lengthy, drawn out chases escaping the killer will earn more points for their boldness, and you can rack up the points by rescuing other survivors who have been captured but not yet sacrificed. As a killer you're rewarded for killing more of the survivors, although a single sacrifice is counted as a victory. Inevitably though, this scoring system leads to immersion-breaking actions like exploiting the killer's slow movement past obstacles, as survivors earn huge points by taunting their hunter.

Another problem for Dead by Daylight is its matchmaking system. The game is entirely peer-to-peer hosted, with the killer hosting the survivors at all times. Unfortunately there's no way to tell where in the world the killer is or whether they're capable of hosting five people in a game until you're playing. There's no ping indicator and no regional matchmaking, so you have to roll the dice each time you join a new server--and if you crap out, you'll warp around the game world barely able to work out what's going on. Further, there's no group-based matchmaking, so you can't queue with friends. This results in players lobby-hopping until they are grouped with friends, which is a terrible experience for all involved.

Dead by Daylight executes the concept of a competitive horror game well, but only to a point. As players become more familiar with both roles, the horror dissipates and they begin to play for the competitive element alone. The poor matchmaking and the highly exploitable scoring system make Dead by Daylight less competitive than it should be, resulting in gameplay which doesn't resemble the horror experience it sets out to be.

Dead by Daylight ist ein grandioses Spiel, welches mir persönlich sehr viel Spaß bereitet. Es gibt allerdings noch recht viele Bugs, die, wie ich hoffen werde, sukzessiv behoben werden. Dennoch empfehlenswert.
挺良心的一款游戏
有很多外挂，想玩的请想好了是自己也开挂还是做个文明有素质的玩家，然后有很多刷血点的菜鸡，菜的要死还开挂刷技能真不知道是想什么，不推荐现在入手这游戏，至少在没有对外挂做出有效的制裁之前，这游戏都是不值得入手的，典型的外挂毁了游戏
